data.title: High CPU usage on simple project
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS 10.12.4.  Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Play any simple project and keep it playing after some time will cause the cpu overloaded and the cpu fans noisy.

**Steps to reproduce:**

data.title: [3.0] Label text translation is not working
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0 master on Archlinux

**Issue description:**
I'm having a crash when translating a label from a long text to a shorter one with error:
```
ERROR: operator[]: Condition ' p_index < 0 || p_index >= size() ' is true. returned: aux
   At: core/vector.h:139.
```

The text is cut when translating a label from a short text to a longer one. Has same quantity of chars as previous text.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Using TranslationServer.set_locale() to change localization on label.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[godot-translation-test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/999605/godot-translation-test.zip)

data.title: Fixed typo 'one short connection' to 'one shot'
3.0 - HighLevelMultiplayer get  latency to server.
data.body:
Godot 3.0

So, I run a couple instances of  my game server , and a very useful function for me (and I think for people in the future) would be the ability to get the latency from client to any of my server instances, that without triggering the client connected/disconnected signals in the server instance.

I don't have the time to learn how networking works and all that stuff, so maybe someone like faless (the only person I'm aware that knows networking) could implement that if it is possible.

data.title: Docs: ERR_EOF -> ERR_FILE_EOF
data.body: in Class: ResourceInteractiveLoader

data.title: AssetInstaller: fix toggling dir bug, scan after install
data.body: This fixes a bug that directory contents remain selected when removing a check mark in the directory TreeItem during asset installation. Also calls EditorFileSystem to scan_changes after installation finishes.

data.title: Stop mouse not working for panel
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Created a panel and it defaults to stop mouse being checked. Panel does not stop mouse. Hovering and clicking is still processed below panel. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a panel (mine was over a tilemap) have mouse detection code in _input underneath panel. Check stop mouse on panel. Mouse motion and click is not stopped. 

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Fixed #8526, popup menu width now responds to submenu icon
exporting to android problem
data.body:
so.. i cant register to forum and the discord stuff.. it never send me any verification code.. i also got ban from irc for no reason and the developer community is a bit dead..  anyone know why it never send me the verification code ? 

main issue :
so i cant export to android.. this is the error..

WARNING: The jar will be treated as unsigned, because it is signed with a weak
algorithm that is now disabled by the security property:

  jdk.jar.disabledAlgorithms=MD2, MD5, RSA keySize < 1024

i already set the keysize to 2048 using -keysize command still not working..
i use this command to create debug key:

keytool -keyalg RSA -genkeypair -alias androiddebugkey -keypass android -keystore debug.keystore -storepass android -dname "CN=Android Debug,O=Android,C=US" -validity 9999

and this..

keytool -genkey -v -keystore debug.keystore -alias androiddebugkey -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 10000

and this..

keytool -genkey -v -keystore debug.keystore -alias androiddebugkey -keyalg RSA -sigalg SHA1withRSA -keysize 4096 -validity 10000 -keysize 2048

none of them are working

it looks like java disable it.. i search it on google on how to activate it.. none of them are working or make sense.. i use the newest version of godot i also try to create the debug key using android studio.. but there is no keytool program there.. i already try to use timestamp stuff.. not working.. i already set the username and pass to androiddebugkey and android.. still not working.. getting the same error..

data.title: KinematicBody2D.move result in weird movement between KinematicBody2D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS godot version 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
when KinematicBody overlapped(for example they are spawned at the same position), call move, even the argument is vector2d(0,0),  the bodies will move to some uncertain positions, far away from its original position, it seems a force  is add to the bodies, and it can even move through  static collide bodies.

**Steps to reproduce:**
create some Kinematic Bodies at the the same position
add some static bodies with rectangular shape  to  create walls surround them
call move on each body
the Kinematic Bodies will move through the static bodies to the outside of the walls

please check the demo project, and click to  make the KinematicBody move
**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[kenimatic.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/999211/kenimatic.zip)

data.title: MFI gamepad support for iPhone
data.body:
This is a straight port of the work I did in Godot 2.x with a few things changed due to the renaming of things in Godot 3.0

I haven't been able to test this on Godot 3.0 as the iPhone build is still having some issues but I think it should work.

As Godot 3.0 has iOS 9 as a minimum I have enabled MicroGamepad support here. Hopefully Travis will be happy with that.

data.title: Adding a few macros and functions to capture more error details throwâ€¦
data.body:
This can probably use some more spit and polish but just throwing it in there as I wrote these quickly this morning to debug some iPhone issues.

I've added a couple of macros and a couple of supporting functions to log a little more info about any errors generated by OpenGL. While overkill to do for every command adding these to more failure sensitive functions can help find issues quicker as it will output the location and name of the constant (where I've added it to the list) of the error being thrown.

data.title: iphone build - dereferenced NULL
data.body:
This is purely nitpicking, when building for iOS (maybe also OSX, haven't checked) the build logs are filled with this warning repeating lots:
```
In file included from core/ustring.h:35:
core/vector.h:150:19:{150:20-150:28}: warning: binding dereferenced null pointer to reference has undefined behavior [-Wnull-dereference,2]
                        const T &aux = *((T *)0); //nullreturn

```

I'm wondering if its worth changing the build parameters to suppress this warning or rewrite the line of code. It makes it hard to find the actual errors in building :)

data.title: Tween#follow_* method documentation confusing
data.body:
I'm trying to figure out what the documented [follow_*](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/classes/class_tween.html) methods do, but some non-standard terminology is being used that makes it unnecessarily hard.

The only usages of "follow" I'm familiar with are 1. follow as in an object following a path, or 2. "follow" as in Twitter. What does it mean to follow a method? I've tried mentally replacing "follow" with "subscribe", but that doesn't make sense either. "Monitor" might also work, provided it can't possibly be confused with the synchronization construct.

And then...what does it mean to animate a method?

Lastly there are a couple spelling mistakes -- s/consequitive/consecutive/ and s/begining/beginning/).

---
I'm really just trying to figure out what this method does. If, for example, I have this code:

```
tween.follow_method(get_node("foo"), "calculate", 3, get_node("bar"), "pos_x", 5.0, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN_OUT)
```

then that's is equivalent to the following pseudocode, right?
```
bar_node.pos_x(foo.calculate(3))
for i in 5 seconds:
    var tweened_value = 3 + calculate_tween(i, 5.0, TRANS_LINEAR, EASE_IN_OUT)
    bar_node.pos_x(foo.calculate(tweened_value))
```
Actually, I'm reasonably sure this is incorrect -- I'm not sure how to incorporate the `Methods are animated by calling them with consequitive values.` statement. Would appreciate some help ðŸ˜„

`vec4 test = WORLD_MATRIX.x;`

When I type this line mesh transforms into big white artifact :)

data.title: Convex collision shapes + kinematic body + look_at + move = cpu catches fire
data.body:
Arch Linux x86_64 - godot v.2.1.3


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Create a convex body autogenerated by godot, run `look_at()` and the `move()` in the same `_fixed_update()` call while 2 of these bodies are colliding.
Expected result: Works fine, handles it properly
Actual result: CPU spikes to 100% and framerate drops from 60fps to 0.2

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a kinematicbody2d
Add collision shape
Apply convex shape to it (I'm not sure of the specifics, I know a cube doesn't work but the attached one does)
Spawn 2 so they move in the same direction
Fry eggs with your CPU (CPU spikes)

I apologize for these not giving enough specifics, I am unsure as to exactly what about this body causes godot to murder my computer. It isn't particularly complex.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[Bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/998984/Bug.zip)

data.title: Varying in shader is not working
data.body:
**Ubuntu - Godot version: 3.0 master**
nvidia GeForce GTX 570

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Varying variables are not working in shader lang.
When I try to use it, mesh that has assigned current shader becomes big white something :D 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try:
```
varying vec4 meh;

void vertex() {
	meh = vec4(0);
}
```

data.title: tool script won't print to console
data.body:
macOS Sierra Godot 2.1.3

**Issue**
Adding the tool keyword to a script enables the script within the editor for custom functionality. In order to debug, you would expect to use print() and get information in the Output section but print() only works when running as a game and not when running in the editor

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new project, add a script, add the tool keyword at the beginning, restart godot or the project.
Add print("Hello") to the script. You would expect it to work in the editor like in a game, but only works in-game. 
Add a second scene and switching between 2 scene tabs in 2D mode triggers the _ready function. Any other code will execute except the print function

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Tool print.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/998913/Tool.print.zip)

data.title: SpatialMaterial - missing Ambient Light factor/Color
data.body:
3.0 SpatialMaterial and ShaderMaterial are affected by AmbientLight from WorldEnvironment node.
Problem is there is no way to control how much they are affected per material basis.

Additional property for materials should be added allowing to control how much they receive (or override) Ambient Light or how they tint it their way.
Very important for stylized rendering and not only.

data.title: Pin for Shader Editor
data.body:
**Godot 3.0 master**

Pinning for Shader Editor is needed badly. :D 
For now testing shader is really unpleasant. xD
If you do anything in 3D view, Shader Editor closes.
If you want to try your fresh new uniforms in material, switching to material in Inspector also closes Shader Editor.
This is madness :D

Can't start project from editor (neither F5 nor F6). Output only says debug process started, then debug process stopped.
Console reveals that connection to remote debugger failed (status 1, then status 3 twice, then 
Remote Debugger unable to connect.

**Steps to reproduce:**

<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: [GDNative] fixed a reload bug
data.body:
When there was no terminate function defined in the library the exported variables would not update.
This fixes that.

data.title: Names of ClassDB-bound methods changed
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 4.11
Godot master e883cdafa6f3b98d1f30e555aed0044782f6a5c4

**Issue description:**
Some bound methods were renamed in 3.0. This brings issues, when those methods are called from C++ code. This is an example from scene/gui/tree.cpp:
```v_scroll->call_deferred("set_val", ofs - screenh + h);```
It fails (silently) because "set_val" was renamed into "set_value" in 3.0.

This probably happens in other files, too. Checking all occurrences of call_deferred() and related functions that call bound methods will be necessary.
Also displaying an error when a call fails would make debugging easier.

The example above is the cause for a bug, where trees don't scroll when using the arrow-down key to navigate.

data.title: OBJ files and DAE (better dae) are not imported correctly. Absent in .import folder.
data.body:
**Ubuntu - Godot 3.0-master (e883cda)**


**Issue description:**
3.0 Obj and DAE are not imported correctly. They are absent in .import folder.
Loading .obj to mesh instance is not working - "not a resource".
Opening DAE also - "Error loading scene".

data.title: Implemented scrolling factor for precision trackpads for 2.1
data.body: With several fixes for 2.1 due to API differences from master branch. This solves #492 and #3913, and is directly port from PR #7864.

data.title: The quest to get the iPhone build going
data.body:
Hey all,

I've spend a bunch of time this morning seeing if I could get the iPhone build going for Godot 3.0.
Most of that was spend on chasing a wild goose around for an issue that had been plaguing me since I got started try to get the iOS port going.

Anyway, the root problem was simply that it wasn't loading the data.pck file, as a result the initialisation of Godot starts cleaning stuff up, but the code inside of the iOS implementation kept going like nothing was wrong eventually ending in exception errors. I'll do a quick PR in a minute that at least exits the application nicely if things fail. It does give a nice message in the logs that it can't find any files to load but the exception error threw me off.

I don't know if this is a missing setting or something that hasn't changed yet in the iOS implementation but the code looking for the pck file to open is using the executable name. In the XCode template that is godot_opt.iphone which ends up in godot_opt.pck being opened, not data.pck. Simply renaming the file allowed it to load the game files.

So it boots up now, but we're still getting errors. In initializing the GLES rendered it's failing at some point:
```
GLES3: max extensions: 19
GLES3: max ubo light: 102
GLES3: max ubo reflections: 113, ubo size: 144
[1;31mERROR: initialize: [0m[1mCondition ' status != 0x8CD5 ' is true. Continuing..:
[0;31m   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_scene_gles3.cpp:4845.[0m
[1;31mERROR: initialize: [0m[1mCondition ' status != 0x8CD5 ' is true. Continuing..:
```

And probably as a cascade error we're getting this in every frame:
```
2017-05-13 13:20:15.399088+1000 godot_opt.iphone[16026:7192622] [MC] Reading from public effective user settings.
2017-05-13 13:20:15.640 godot_opt.iphone[16026:7192622] 506 error
[1;31mERROR: _render_target_allocate: [0m[1mCondition ' status != 0x8CD5 ' is true.
[0;31m   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp:5814.[0m
[1;31mERROR: load_image: [0m[1mError opening file: res://icon.png
[0;31m   At: core/io/image_loader.cpp:53.[0m
2017-05-13 13:20:15.755 godot_opt.iphone[16026:7192622] 506 error
2017-05-13 13:20:15.755 godot_opt.iphone[16026:7192622] 506 error
2017-05-13 13:20:15.756 godot_opt.iphone[16026:7192622] 506 error
2017-05-13 13:20:15.756 godot_opt.iphone[16026:7192622] 506 error
```

The 506 error repeats. My guess is that the opengl context isn't being instantiated properly, we're probably missing a few more hints, as it is not able to create the render target. I'll keep stepping through the code and see if I can trap where the GLES3 initialisation fails, I've found XCode to be really unfriendly when debugging if it isn't the one compiling the code...

data.title: Shader 3.0 - enum hints for uniforms
data.body:
Godot 3.x

Would be great to have `enums` or something similar for `uniforms` in shader lang.
So it would be easier to add switchable functionality, instead documenting for user which `int` does what.

data.title: Array.sort_custom did not work as expected sometimes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS  godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

func sot_array_rand(e1, e2):
	return randf() > 0.5

func test():
    randomize()		
    var array = [1,2,3]		
    array.sort_custom(self, "sot_array_rand")	
    print(array)

output
[3,2,1]
[3,1,2]
[3,2,1]
[[],2,1]   WHAT IS THAT???
**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
